channel.title: Award@yahoo.com
channel.description: Hello, today I got an email from award@yahoo.com saying that I won 400,000 USD and I was like, wtf? I hadn't taken part in any lottery or anything like that so I thought that this might be a scam or something, or could this be the real deal? I don't know what I should do, there was some codes like send your name, address, age/occupation, then they put a serial number and the winning lottery number and they said email it to [hidden] and I havn't sent anything yet. People, should I give my information there, incase it's real? It said something about Bill Gates donating 300,000 and someone else 100,000.

item.title: Award@yahoo.com
item.dc:creator: @gothic_queen casey.
item.description:
@gothic_queen wrote:

Lol, I got this pop up once, and it said I won a free ipod nano, all I needed to enter was my credit card info.

I don’t even care, I ignore these emails.

Read full topic

item.title: Award@yahoo.com
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Send them to yahoo, get that account disabled.

Read full topic

item.title: Award@yahoo.com
item.dc:creator: @Eh_Pretty_Easy Eh Pretty Easy
item.description:
@Eh_Pretty_Easy wrote:

Maybe, but in the email it said we you to send us your details, and we will confirm them and send the check so they couldn’t have taken credit card numbers because of check

Read full topic

item.title: Award@yahoo.com
item.dc:creator: @gothic_queen casey.
item.description:
@gothic_queen wrote:

Obviously the return emails asks for you credit card # and social security

I get these all the time…lol

Read full topic

item.description:
@Eh_Pretty_Easy wrote:

Thanks, good to know. In my email they were talking about those same informations and fiduciary agent thing and the ticket number. I’m glad that I didn’t send anything.

Read full topic

item.title: Award@yahoo.com
item.dc:creator: @Uriko Uriko
item.description:
@Uriko wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:9, topic:115426”]who would pick the name ‘reward’@yahoo.com… F4K3[/quote]award*

I get them all the time, I just click “Report Phishing” in gmail.

Ex.

item.title: Award@yahoo.com
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

Eh Pretty Easy:

Damn, I really had my hopes up, but why would they want information if they’re not asking for credit card information, they just say that email those things or give us a call and we’ll send you the check.

well if you call them, they may ask you to hold the line… and they are probably charging something like $100 a minute or something stupid like that… but it isnt illegal because they will probably say that it costs that much but because you think you are getting $400,000 you wont care… untill they wont give it to you and you’ve lost lots of money through phone bills.

But i’m not sure about the email thing… they will probably just sell your information (address and email address) to other 3rd parties.

Read full topic
